meanings.definition: To thrust a pointed weapon into or through (someone or something)
meanings.sent1: He tried to stab the tree with a stick.
meanings.sent2: The villain attempted to stab the hero with a dagger.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally stabbed the tomato instead of cutting it.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to stab him in the heart.
meanings.sent5: The image of the sword stabbing through the dragon was vivid in his mind.

meanings.sent1: The doctor treated the stab on his arm carefully.
meanings.sent2: The police found evidence of a recent stab on the victim's back.
meanings.sent3: She joked that the stab from the needle felt like a tiny bee sting.
meanings.sent4: The stab of betrayal left a lasting mark on his trust.
meanings.sent5: The stab on the painting made it look like a real crime scene.

meanings.definition: A sudden sharp feeling or emotion
meanings.sent1: The stab of fear made her heart race.
meanings.sent2: He felt a sudden stab of jealousy when he saw his ex with someone else.
meanings.sent3: The stab of excitement before the roller coaster ride was thrilling.
meanings.sent4: The stab of nostalgia hit him as he walked past his childhood home.
meanings.sent5: The stab of disappointment was hard to bear after all the anticipation.
